alert.note: Alert for Greeley; Logan; Wallace; Wichita (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 03 at 10:31PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wichita, Wallace, southwestern Logan and Greeley Counties through 1015 PM MDT/1115 PM CDT/... At 931 PM MDT/1031 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles north of Sharon Springs to 14 miles southeast of Tribune. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Wallace around 950 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This thunderstorm will produce strong winds resulting in areas of low visibility in blowing dirt. Use extreme caution if you must travel and be alert for rapidly changing visibility. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT/midnight CDT/ for east central Colorado. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 300 AM MDT/400 AM CDT/ for west central Kansas.
